newsitem.title: UK: Euro oil swaps steady to firmer, CFDs, mogas gain.
newsitem.headline: Euro oil swaps steady to firmer, CFDs, mogas gain.

text.p: European oil swaps were steady to firmer on Monday with Brent CFDs stronger by a few cents close in and weaker further out. Gasoline gained $1 across the board. Fuel and naphtha were unchanged.

Brent CFDs gained a few cents after a shaky start this morning. June 30-July 4 was pegged at -21/22 cents against August Brent from -26 cents on Friday, while July 7-11 was assessed at -27 cents from -28 cents. Further out contracts were a couple of cents easier at -30 cents and -31 cents for July 14-18 and July 21-25 respectively.
July 7-11 was done several times with -25 cents and -29 cents done against August Brent and -37 cents traded against September Brent. A July 7-11/July 14-18 rollover traded at +2 cents.
Heavy fuel oil showed early signs of firmness, but the promise failed to materialise and dealers said July was pegged around $83.50 with July valued 75 cents or so stronger.
Low sulphur swaps saw a July contract trade at $93.625, but overall fuel activity was dullish.
Gasoline tracked screen crude higher and July swaps traded at $186 and $185.50 against a value of $184.50 on Friday. August and September remained resolutely in backwardation of $1.50 apiece.
Naphtha was flat despite the gains on crude and gasoline. Dealers said a wet overhang was affecting the market. July swaps were holding around $173.50 to $174 while August was either side of $177.
